title: Is continuing dialogue an appropriate form for writing a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sure it is, but ask yourself “am I using this technique because it is the most appropriate form to tell the story that I am trying to tell,” or “this seems clever, I’ll do this.” If the latter, well, I think you should give it a bit of a miss.

It can be done, but I wouldn’t try it myself because I feel that it’s too far beyond my current limitations. I wrote a shorter piece (650 words) that was almost exclusively dialogue, and that seemed to work reasonably well. I wouldn’t want to do it with anything much longer though.
